intro: Eriolaena yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan eriolaena, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in forested areas at moderate altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
